comment:
The morphological analysis of ɛsɛsɛ according to Owusu (2014):
Ɛ-sɛ-sɛ: expletive-fit-Comp

words: Ɛsɛsɛ	Ann 	wɔ 	lake 	no 	ho 	sesei 	ara
gloss: MOD 	Ann 	be 	lake 	DET 	beside 	right 	now
translation: Ann should be at the lake right now

words: ɛwɔsɛ 	Ann 	wɔ 	lake 	no 	ho 	sesei 	ara
gloss: MOD	Ann	be	lake	DET	beside	right	now
translation: Ann should be at the lake right now

words: sɛ 			ɛsɛsɛ 	nsuo 	no 	tɔ 	sesei	ara 	wɔ Goa
gloss: EXPLETIVE.PRO 	MOD 	water 	DET 	fall 	right 	now 	in   Goa
translation: It should be raining right now in Goa

words: sɛ 			ɛwɔsɛ 	nsuo 	no 	tɔ 	sesei 	ara 	wɔ 	Goa
gloss: EXPLETIVE.PRO	MOD	water	DET	fall	right	now	in	Goa
translation: It should be raining right now in Goa

comment: morphological analysis of "ebetumi": Ebetumi = 3sg + be + tumi

words: Me-hwɛ nea ɛ-re-keka kͻ yi a, ͻman yi mu tumi kyɛ
gloss: 1SG-look what 3SG-PROG-say go DET, REL nation DET in MOD divide
translation: Looking at what is going on, the nation can be divided

words: Nnea ͻmmo yɛ yi nyinaa tumi de ntͻkwa ba.
gloss: what 3PL do DET all MOD take fight come
translation: What they are doing can result in a fight.

words: Ebetumi 		aba 		sɛ 	Mary 	eni 	efie
gloss: MOD happen COMP Mary not home
translation: It may be that Mary is not home

comment: Neg semantically scopes over "tumi". Comment by a native external reviewer: "he sentence is odd because the negated form of the main verb is incorrect. And the sentence also sounds very non-native."

translation: So it can't be in C

comment: "be" is a future marker, but may not have the meaning of future tense in this sentence
ungrammatical as an assertion; with a rising tone in the final vowel, it can work as a question “are you allowed to enter?”

words: Beth	be-tumi 	a-kɔ 		dware 	nsuo 	mu
gloss: Beth 	FUT-MOD 	PERF-go 	bathe	water 	in
translation: Beth is allowed to go swimming

words: Beth 	wɔ 	hokwan 	sɛ 	o-dware 	nsuo 	mu
gloss: Beth         have         permission         COMP         pro-bathe        water         in
translation: Beth has permission to bathe in water

words: ɛwɔsɛ me-hyɛ ataadeɛ papa, nanso ɛnsɛsɛ me-hyɛ ataadeɛ papa
gloss: MOD 1SG-wear dress good, but MOD 1SG-wear dress good
translation: I should wear good clothes but I don’t have to
comment: The second clause also has the reading “I must not wear good clothes” (would be odd in conjunction with the first clause)

words: ɛwɔsɛ me-hyɛ ataadeɛ papa, nanso ɛ-ho-n-hia sɛ me-hyɛ ataadeɛ papa
gloss: MOD 1SG-wear dress good, but MOD COMP 1SG-wear dress good
translation: I should wear good clothes but I don’t have to

gloss: MOD 1SG-wear dress good, but MOD 1SG-wear dress good
comment: Initial reaction: this is slightly unnatural

words: Me-pɛsɛ mehyɛ ataade papa, nanso ɛnwsɛ me-hyɛ ataade papa
gloss: 1sg-want 1SG-wear dress good, but MOD 1SG-wear dress good
translation: I want to wear formal clothes but I don't have to
